intro: Diplostephium asplundii, commonly known as the Mexican goldenbush, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its yellowish-orange flowers that bloom in dense, branched inflorescences. The plant is typically found in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid environments. It has small, narrow leaves that help reduce water loss, and its structure supports its role as a pioneer species in disturbed soils. The plant's botanical features make it an important component of its native ecosystem.
